quests.quest_description: Defeat the minions and the final boss by mastering all the dermal cell types!

questions.question: The most superficial layer of the skin
Produce a protein called keratin, a tough, fibrous protein that helps protect the skin and underlying tissue from abrasion, heat, microbes, and chemicals
Produce the pigment melanin, which contributes to skin color and absorbs damaging UV light
Participate in immune response against microbes that invade the skin
Located in the deepest layer of the epidermis where they contact the flattened process of a sensory neuron
Consists of 25-30 layers of dead keratinocytes
Consists of 4-6 layers of dead keratinocytes
Consists of 3-5 layers of flattened keratinocytes undergoing apoptosis
Thick layer of living keratinocytes, intraepidermal macrophages, and projections from melanocytes
Consist of single row of cuboidal or columnar keratinocytes that serve as stem cells
Process by which epithelial cells become filled with keratin protein filaments, die, and form tough, resistant structures
Lies deep to the epidermis and is much thicker
Region of the dermis made of areolar connective tissue with dermal papillae that create epidermal ridges
Region of the dermis made of dense irregular connective tissue; contains hair follicles, nerves, sebaceous glands, and sudoriferous glands
Detects pain, itch, tickle, temperature
Detects touch and pressure at skin surface
Detects onset of touch and low frequency vibrations
Detects stretch and pressure
Detects movements on skin surface that disturb hairs
Detects high-frequency vibration
Glands that secrete a substance called sebum into hair follicles
Glands that secrete sweat into hair follicles or onto skin surface
Secretion method where all cells of the secretory portion of the gland collect products and then rupture
Secretion method where glands secrete continuously
Glands that secrete sweat directly onto skin surface and are found all throughout the skin
Glands that often secrete sweat into hair follicles and are found in sweaty parts of the skin
